repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Itaparica Resettlement and
            Irrigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project was rated unsatisfactory.
            The following are some of the key lessons learned: 1) Time
            demands mandated a simpler project design. 2) The
            Bank's resettlement policy can sometimes create
            entitlements which imply difficult trade-offs. 3) Realistic
            assessment of the true costs of the irrigation/production
            package is essential. 4) Issues of subsidies for energy
            supply should be discussed and agreed during preparation and
            included in resettlement agreements signed by the affected
            parties. 5) In an inflationary environment and where large
            investments are involved, special attention to financial
            estimation is required to reduce risks. 6) Resettlement
            projects may be inappropriate candidates for economic
            justification in their own right. 7) There were clear
            differences between the challenges posed by urban
            resettlement and rural resettlement. 8) The Bank should
            pursue the full support of state and local authorities for
            the public utilities, social services, and other elements of
            resettlement propjets. 9) Disbursement percentages on major
            project components should be considered strategically,
            factoring in project objectives and timing. 10)
            Participation of resettlers in decision-making if conducted
            in a pressured, politically charged environment can force
            poor decisions.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Itaparica Resettlement and
            Irrigation Project : Request for Inspection

abstracts.cdata!:
The Request for Inspection for The
            Itaparica Resettlement and Irrigation Project outlines
            problems caused to the indigenous communities displaced by
            the construction of the Itaparica dam. The Request,
            supported by the group Polo Sindical do Submedio Sao
            Francisco, states that the resettlement plans have not been
            fulfilled and that the better living conditions promised to
            the resettled people have not occurred. The Request
            acknowledges the importance of the dam in bringing
            electricity to millions of people, but also states that over
            150,000 people were resettled and have not received the
            improved living conditions that were promised.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Itaparica Resettlement and
            Irrigation Project : Management Response to the Request for Inspection

abstracts.cdata!:
The Management Response to the Request
            for Inspection reports on the problems outlined in the
            Request for Inspection of the Itaparica Resettlement and
            Irrigation Project in Brazil.  The Management announces it
            is well aware of the problems described in the Request and
            provides data concerning the completion of the irrigation
            projects.  The Response addresses the complaints that the
            Bank's guidelines were not followed and that the
            resettled communities are unable to resume production
            because of the irrigation problems. The Management Response
            elaborates on the fact that other agencies were primarily
            responsible for several aspects of the project and that the
            Management's involvement was therefore limited.  The
            Management concludes that it complied with all their
            guidelines, but there were still delays and insufficiencies
            throughout the implementation of  the project.  Through
            cooperation with the Government of Brazil and other agencies
            involved with the project, the Management feels that they
            will complete the project.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Itaparica Resettlement and
            Irrigation Project : Eligibility Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Eligibility Report for the Itaparica
            Resettlement and Irrigation Project in Brazil retraces the
            Request for Inspection and the Management Response,
            including detailed reports of each complaint to be
            investigated.  The Eligibility Report recommends that an
            investigation into the project be organized.  The
            investigation shows that there have been adverse effects on
            the resettled people and that Bank policies may have been
            violated.  While the recommendations are valid, the
            cooperation of all the organizations involved hinders the
            resolution of the complaints.
